# Echo Registry API - Quick Start Guide for AI Agents
# Get latest versions of Minecraft mod loaders and dependencies instantly

## What this service does:
Echo Registry provides up-to-date version data for Forge, NeoForge, Fabric, and popular Minecraft mods through a simple REST API. Perfect for automated build systems and dependency management.

## Base URL: https://echo.iamkaf.com
## OpenAPI Specification: https://echo.iamkaf.com/openapi.json

## Available Endpoints:

### 1. Health Check
GET /api/health
Returns service status and external API connectivity. Use this to verify the service is running.

### 2. Get Supported Minecraft Versions
GET /api/versions/minecraft
Returns all supported Minecraft versions with their types (release, snapshot, etc.).

### 3. Get Dependencies for Minecraft Version
GET /api/versions/dependencies/{mc_version}
This is the main endpoint you'll use.

Examples:
- GET /api/versions/dependencies/1.21.1
- GET /api/versions/dependencies/1.20.6
- GET /api/versions/dependencies/1.21.1?projects=fabric-api,modmenu

The optional ?projects parameter lets you fetch specific mods instead of all available dependencies.
If any value in ?projects is not a valid Modrinth project slug, the endpoint returns HTTP 400 with a message listing the invalid values.
Do not pass built-in dependencies (`forge`, `neoforge`, `fabric-loader`, `parchment`, `neoform`, `moddev-gradle`, `forgegradle`, `loom`) in ?projects; they are always included automatically.

### 4. Check Project Compatibility
GET /api/projects/compatibility?projects={projects}&versions={versions}
Check which Modrinth projects are compatible with specific loaders across multiple Minecraft versions and returns version information.

Examples:
- GET /api/projects/compatibility?projects=fabric-api&versions=1.21.1
- GET /api/projects/compatibility?projects=fabric-api,amber,sodium&versions=1.20.1,1.21.1

Parameters:
- projects: Comma-separated Modrinth project slugs (required)
- versions: Comma-separated Minecraft versions (required)

Response format:
{
  "data": {
    "forge": {
      "1.21.10": {
        "forge": "60.1.0",
        "neoforge": null,
        "fabric": null
      }
    },
    "neoforge": {
      "1.21.10": {
        "forge": null,
        "neoforge": "21.10.63",
        "fabric": null
      }
    },
    "fabric-api": {
      "1.21.10": {
        "forge": null,
        "neoforge": null,
        "fabric": "0.138.3+1.21.10"
      }
    },
    "amber": {
      "1.21.10": {
        "forge": "8.1.0+1.21.10",
        "neoforge": "8.1.0+1.21.10",
        "fabric": "8.1.0+1.21.10"
      }
    },
    "jade": {
      "1.21.10": {
        "forge": null,
        "neoforge": "20.0.5+neoforge",
        "fabric": "20.1.0+fabric"
      }
    }
  },
  "timestamp": "2025-01-XX...",
  "cached_at": "2025-01-XX...",
  "success": true
}

Note: Every response includes all three loaders (forge, neoforge, fabric) with version strings exactly as provided by mod authors, or null if unavailable. This ensures consistent response format across all requests.

## What Dependencies Are Available:
- Loaders: Forge, NeoForge, Fabric Loader
- Popular Mods: Fabric API, Mod Menu, REI, JEI, Architectury API, Amber, Forge Config API Port or any other mod hosted on Modrinth
- Dev Tools: Parchment Mappings, NeoForm, ForgeGradle, ModDev Gradle

## Response Format:
All endpoints return JSON with this structure:
{
  "data": { ... },
  "timestamp": "2025-01-XX...",
  "cached_at": "2025-01-XX...",
  "success": true
}

For dependency endpoints, data includes:
- mc_version: The Minecraft version
- dependencies: Array of objects with name, version, loader, source_url, download_urls

## Success Field:
All API responses include a required "success" boolean field:
- "success": true - Request completed successfully and contains data
- "success": false - Request failed and contains an error message
- Health endpoint: "success": true for HTTP 200, "success": false for server errors

## Rate Limiting & Caching:
- Responses are cached to reduce external API load
- Check the "cached_at" timestamp in responses
- Use health check endpoint to monitor service status

## Error Handling:
- 400: Bad request (invalid parameters)
- 500: Server error (external service issues)
- All error responses include "success": false, descriptive message and timestamp

## Production Usage:
Deployed at: https://echo.iamkaf.com
The service runs on Vercel with automated cache cleanup daily at noon.
Source code available on GitHub for reference or contributions.
